notes: Genry Donaldo Ruiz-Guillen, 29-year-old Honduran national, died at Larkin Community Hospital after being detained at Krome. Suffered from rhabdomyolysis (muscle breakdown leading to kidney failure). Had been hospitalized since Dec 9, 2024. Mother said he complained of fainting spells in his last call. Part of pattern of deaths at Krome facility.

Serawit Gezahegn Dejene, 45-year-old Ethiopian national, died at Banner University Medical Center. Death related to untreated HIV - experts said routine blood tests would have immediately shown HIV and death was 'entirely preventable'. Hospitalized since Dec 23, 2024. Eloy Detention Center has at least 16 reported deaths including 5 suicides.

facility: Nassau County Correctional Center, East Meadow
cause_of_death: Liver failure complicated by alcoholism (disputed by family)
notes: Dead within 18 hours of being placed in detention. Medical professionals said it would be 'highly unusual' for someone with liver failure not to show symptoms 18 hours before death. NY Attorney General investigating.
Scheduled for deportation on December 13, the day before his death was officially pronounced. Found without pulse on December 4.

Shot at close range after dropping children off at school. Bullet traveled through back of neck to chest. Cook County Medical Examiner ruled homicide. Single father of two boys (ages 6 and 3). No criminal history - only traffic violations. Bodycam footage contradicts DHS claims he dragged agents. Mexican President called for investigation. Body repatriated to Michoacan.
jurisdiction_notes: Chicago suburb under Illinois TRUST Act.

notes: Border Patrol agents spotted several people in camouflage walking north from border. During apprehension, physical altercation ensued. Agent reported being in fight and needing help. Three gunshot wounds inflicted. Occurred during suspected narcotics smuggling operation. Texas Rangers investigating.

medical_condition: Hypertensive crisis (blood pressure 226/57) documented before transport
outcome: Death during transport from jail to detention center
outcome_detail: Avellaneda-Delgado died May 5, 2025 during transport from Lowndes County Jail to Stewart Detention Center by TransCor (CoreCivic subsidiary). Pronounced deceased by Webster County Coroner at 1:25 PM ET. Medical records show blood pressure of 226/57 (hypertensive crisis/stroke-level) before release. Webster County Coroner stated 'When the ambulance got there, he was dead. He was cold to the touch, so he had been dead.' Forensic pathologist Dr. Kris Sperry confirmed it takes 30-45 minutes for body to become 'cool to touch.'
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Major discrepancies: TransCor told 911 'medical department cleared him for travel, no noticeable medical conditions.' Yet EMS records showed stroke-level blood pressure. Acting ICE director Todd Lyons said 'We have nothing to hide' but official death report omits cause of death or medical detail. Family said he had no prior health conditions. Senators Warnock and Ossoff demanded answers. Arrested April 9, 2025 by Echols County Sheriff for probation violation.

cause_of_death: Cardiac arrest from alcohol withdrawal symptoms
outcome: Death 10 days after detention, family not notified until deathbed
outcome_detail: Gabriel Garcia-Aviles died October 23, 2025 - just 10 days after transfer to Adelanto following Costa Mesa arrest. Beloved community member, family man with work permit, lived in US over 30 years. When daughter arrived, found him 'unconscious, intubated, and with dried blood on his forehead.' ICE only notified family when he was on deathbed. Federal lawmakers demanded answers in December 23, 2025 letter to DHS Secretary Noem and ICE Director Lyons.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Second Adelanto death in 2025 (after Ayala-Uribe). ICE missed deadline to release death report. ICE stopped paying outside medical providers since October 3, 2025 - 'no mechanism to provide prescribed medication' or 'pay for medically necessary off-site care.' No dialysis, prenatal care, oncology, chemotherapy. Population ballooned from <40,000 in January to 73,000+.
source_name: KVCR News / LA Taco / CBS Los Angeles

notes: Josue Castro Rivera, 24-year-old Honduras national. Was heading to gardening job when vehicle pulled over by ICE on I-264. Was in vehicle with 3 others. Fled onto busy highway when agents began detaining occupants. Struck by Ford pickup truck. ICE did NOT have a removal order for him. Had no criminal record. Had been in US 4 years.
jurisdiction_notes: Virginia has no statewide policy. Norfolk generally cooperative.

notes: Jaime Alanis Garcia, 57-year-old Mexico national. First known death during Trump ICE raid. Fell 30 feet from Glass House Farms cannabis greenhouse roof while hiding/fleeing. Broke neck, died after 3 days on life support. DHS says he was not "pursued" but family says he was hiding. ~200 arrested in raid, 10 minors found. GoFundMe raised 50k+.
jurisdiction_notes: Ventura County. Site of ICE detention facility deaths.

notes: Felix Baukholt, German national on expired H1B visa. Traffic stop for immigration inspection. Female companion Teresa Youngblut opened fire "without warning," killing both Baukholt and Border Patrol Agent David Maland. Couple had been observed in tactical gear at hotels.
jurisdiction_notes: Under Vermont Act 69. Rural area near Canadian border.

notes: Keith Porter, 43-year-old US citizen and African-American father of two. Shot on New Year's Eve by off-duty ICE agent Brian Palacios. DHS claims Porter was firing celebratory shots with rifle and pointed weapon at agent. Family disputes account. No charges filed against agent.
jurisdiction_notes: LA neighborhood. Under California Values Act.

notes: Lawful Permanent Resident. Hospitalized for fever, died the next day. Krome facility had 5 medical violations and 14 total violations including overcrowding with people sleeping on floors.
jurisdiction_notes: Ended sanctuary policy 2017 after state law.

name: Parady La
outcome_detail: Died from drug withdrawal in ICE detention; family accused ICE of medical neglect, saying he was begging for help in final hours
notes: January 2026: Parady La, 46-year-old Cambodian refugee, died from drug withdrawal in ICE detention in Philadelphia. La's family accused ICE of medical neglect, saying they were told he was begging for help in the final hours of his life.
jurisdiction_notes: City policy in neutral state. Executive Order 2016.

name: Cuban man (unnamed)
outcome_detail: ICE initially reported suicide; witness said he was choked by guard; medical examiner ruled homicide
notes: January 3, 2026: 55-year-old Cuban man died in ICE detention at Camp East Montana. ICE initially said his death was a suicide, but a witness stated he was choked by a guard. Subsequently, the medical examiner ruled the death a homicide.

name: Geraldo Lunas Campos
cause_of_death: Asphyxia due to neck and chest compression (homicide)
outcome_detail: Preliminary cause: asphyxia due to neck and chest compression, suggesting homicide. Occurred at military base detention facility.
notes: January 3, 2026: Geraldo Lunas Campos, 55-year-old Cuban migrant, died at Camp East Montana on Fort Bliss military base. Preliminary cause of death reported as 'asphyxia due to neck and chest compression,' suggesting homicide ruling pending toxicology results.
jurisdiction_notes: Military base used for migrant detention. Federal jurisdiction on base.

name: Victor Manuel Diaz
outcome_detail: Died of 'presumed suicide' at Camp East Montana tent complex. At least third death at the facility.
notes: January 14, 2026: Victor Manuel Diaz, 36-year-old Nicaraguan national, died of 'presumed suicide' at Camp East Montana tent complex at Fort Bliss. This was at least the third death reported at the facility.
jurisdiction_notes: Military base used for migrant detention. Federal jurisdiction on base.

name: Francisco Gaspar-Andres
outcome_detail: First death at Camp East Montana. Died from liver and kidney failure. Facility documented to have violated 60+ federal standards in first 50 days.
notes: December 3, 2025: Francisco Gaspar-Andres, 48-year-old Guatemalan man, was the first death at Camp East Montana (opened August 2025). ICE reported cause as liver and kidney failure. Facility violated at least 60 federal standards during its first 50 days of operation.
jurisdiction_notes: Military base used for migrant detention. Federal jurisdiction on base.

name: Jean Wilson Brutus
outcome_detail: Died at University Hospital Newark following medical emergency at detention facility. Had entered ICE custody only the day before after arrest for criminal mischief.
notes: December 12, 2025: Jean Wilson Brutus, 41-year-old Haitian man, died at University Hospital Newark following medical emergency at Delaney Hall Detention Facility. He had entered ICE custody only the day before, on December 11, 2025, after being arrested for criminal mischief.
jurisdiction_notes: Mayor Ras Baraka publicly defied ICE Jan 2025.

name: Hasan Ali Moh'D Saleh
outcome_detail: Lawful permanent resident transferred to Krome September 14. Transported to Larkin Community Hospital due to fever on October 10; died the next day.
notes: October 11, 2025: Hasan Ali Moh'D Saleh, a lawful permanent resident, died after being transferred to Krome on September 14, 2025. On October 10, he was transported to Larkin Community Hospital due to fever; the next day he was dead.
jurisdiction_notes: Ended sanctuary policy 2017 after state law.
